name: Heroes' Podium
text:
Each legendary creature you control gets +1/+1 for each other legendary creature you control.
{X}, {T}: Look at the top X cards of your library. You may reveal a legendary creature card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.

name: Heroes Remembered
text:
You gain 20 life.
Suspend 10—{W} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {W} and exile it with ten time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)

name: Heroes' Reunion
text: Target player gains 7 life.

editions.flavor:
"You helped save my people from a Phyrexian fate. Did you think I wouldn't return the favor?"
—Eladamri, to Gerrard
They share no bloodline, but a bond greater than family unites them. Such are the gifts of the Worldsoul.

"You helped save my people from a Phyrexian fate. Did you think I wouldn't return the favor?"
—Eladamri, to Gerrard

"You helped save my people from a Phyrexian fate. Did you think I wouldn't return the favor?"
—Eladamri, to Gerrard

name: Heroic Defiance
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 unless it shares a color with the most common color among all permanents or a color tied for most common.

editions.flavor:
"Wear courage as your armor. Wield honor as your blade."
—Gerrard

name: Heroic Intervention
text: Permanents you control gain hexproof and indestructible until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Wherever the strong would harm the weak, I will be there."
—Ajani Goldmane

name: Heroism
text: Sacrifice a white creature: For each attacking red creature, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by that creature this turn unless its controller pays {2}{R}.

name: Heron's Grace Champion
text:
Flash
Lifelink
When Heron's Grace Champion enters the battlefield, other Humans you control get +1/+1 and gain lifelink until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Sigarda was the last uncorrupted archangel, but she would not have to fight alone.

name: Hero of Bladehold
text:
Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
Whenever Hero of Bladehold attacks, create two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens that are tapped and attacking.

name: Hero of Goma Fada
text: Rally — Whenever Hero of Goma Fada or another Ally enters the battlefield under your control, creatures you control gain indestructible until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "They seek to break us. Let us show them our strength!"
"They seek to break us. Let us show them our strength!"
"They seek to break us. Let us show them our strength!"

name: Hero of Iroas
text:
Aura spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Hero of Iroas, put a +1/+1 counter on Hero of Iroas.

editions.flavor: "My left has felled a cyclops. My right has slain a giant. I bring both to every fight."

name: Hero of Leina Tower
text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Hero of Leina Tower, you may pay {X}. If you do, put X +1/+1 counters on Hero of Leina Tower.

editions.flavor: "You cannot achieve greatness if its seed has not already been planted in your heart."

name: Hero of Oxid Ridge
text:
Haste
Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
Whenever Hero of Oxid Ridge attacks, creatures with power 1 or less can't block this turn.

name: Hero's Blade

editions.flavor: The best swords are forged with dragonfire.

name: Hero's Demise
text: Destroy target legendary creature.

editions.flavor:
"What will it say on our graves, Lord Konda? Will it say we led our world to conquer immortal forces or that we were crushed by our own arrogance? At each defeat, I wonder."
—Sensei Hisoka, letter to Lord Konda

name: Hero's Downfall
text: Destroy target creature or planeswalker.

editions.flavor: Destiny exalts a chosen few, but even heroes break.
Destiny exalts a chosen few, but even heroes break.

name: Hero's Resolve
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+5.

editions.flavor:
"Destiny, chance, fate, fortune—they're all just ways of claiming your successes without claiming your failures."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

"Destiny, chance, fate, fortune—they're all just ways of claiming your successes without claiming your failures."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

"Destiny, chance, fate, fortune—they're all just ways of claiming your successes without claiming your failures."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Hesitation
text: When a player casts a spell, sacrifice Hesitation and counter that spell.

editions.flavor: Gerrard hesitated, looking up at the enemy ship. The future hesitated with him, changed forever by the pause.

name: Hewed Stone Retainers
text: Cast Hewed Stone Retainers only if you've cast another spell this turn.

editions.flavor:
"Their origins are shrouded in mystery. I believe they are the protectors of the lost secrets of our world."
—Jilaya, Temur whisperer

"Their origins are shrouded in mystery. I believe they are the protectors of the lost secrets of our world."
—Jilaya, Temur whisperer

name: He Who Hungers
text:
Flying
{1}, Sacrifice a Spirit: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
Soulshift 4 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 4 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

name: Hex
text: Destroy six target creatures.

editions.flavor: When killing five just isn't enough.
When killing five just isn't enough.

name: Hex Parasite
text: {X}{B/P}: Remove up to X counters from target permanent. For each counter removed this way, Hex Parasite gets +1/+0 until end of turn. ({B/P} can be paid with either {B} or 2 life.)

editions.flavor: Drawn by power, fueled by conquest.

"Use everything. Iron, rust, scrap . . .  even the ground must join our cause."
—Ezuri, renegade leader

"Use everything. Iron, rust, scrap . . .  even the ground must join our cause."
—Ezuri, renegade leader

name: Hibernation
text: Return all green permanents to their owners' hands.

editions.flavor: On its way to the cave, the armadillo brushed by a sapling. It awoke to find a full-grown tree blocking its path.
The deep sleep of winter is not always restful.
The deep sleep of winter is not always restful.

name: Hibernation's End
text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Whenever you pay Hibernation's End's cumulative upkeep, you may search your library for a creature card with converted mana cost equal to the number of age counters on Hibernation's End and put it onto the battlefield. If you do, shuffle your library.

name: Hibernation Sliver
text: All Slivers have "Pay 2 life: Return this permanent to its owner's hand."

editions.flavor: Mogglings have been known to play ball with hibernating slivers, completely unaware of their true nature.
Mogglings have been known to play ball with hibernating slivers, completely unaware of their true nature.
Mogglings have been known to play ball with hibernating slivers, completely unaware of their true nature.

name: Hickory Woodlot
text:
Hickory Woodlot enters the battlefield tapped with two depletion counters on it.
{T}, Remove a depletion counter from Hickory Woodlot: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool. If there are no depletion counters on Hickory Woodlot, sacrifice it.

name: Hidden Ancients
text: When an opponent casts an enchantment spell, if Hidden Ancients is an enchantment, Hidden Ancients becomes a 5/5 Treefolk creature.

editions.flavor: The only alert the invaders had was the rustling of leaves on a day without wind.

name: Hidden Dragonslayer
text:
Lifelink
Megamorph {2}{W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
When Hidden Dragonslayer is turned face up, destroy target creature with power 4 or greater an opponent controls.

name: Hidden Gibbons
text: When an opponent casts an instant spell, if Hidden Gibbons is an enchantment, Hidden Gibbons becomes a 4/4 Ape creature.

editions.flavor: When these apes want something, it's a matter of gibbon take.

name: Hidden Guerrillas
text: When an opponent casts an artifact spell, if Hidden Guerrillas is an enchantment, Hidden Guerrillas becomes a 5/3 Soldier creature with trample.

name: Hidden Herbalists
text: Revolt — When Hidden Herbalists enters the battlefield, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, add {G}{G} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: In the cellars beneath Narnam House, a strange and deadly garden grows.

name: Hidden Herd
text: When an opponent plays a nonbasic land, if Hidden Herd is an enchantment, Hidden Herd becomes a 3/3 Beast creature.

name: Hidden Horror
text: When Hidden Horror enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a creature card.

editions.flavor: If the presence of evil were obvious, it wouldn't be nearly as dangerous.
Lifespans are measured by its dreadful length.
If the presence of evil were obvious, it wouldn't be nearly as dangerous.

name: Hidden Path
text: Green creatures have forestwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

editions.flavor: "Where moments before we were lost beyond hope, the strange, floating lights showed us the way and restored our morale." —Vervamon the Elder

name: Hidden Predators
text: When an opponent controls a creature with power 4 or greater, if Hidden Predators is an enchantment, Hidden Predators becomes a 4/4 Beast creature.

name: Hidden Retreat
text: Put a card from your hand on top of your library: Prevent all damage that would be dealt by target instant or sorcery spell this turn.

editions.flavor: After an hour in the hidey-hole, Squee seriously pondered the advantages of danger over boredom.

name: Hidden Spider
text: When an opponent casts a creature spell with flying, if Hidden Spider is an enchantment, Hidden Spider becomes a 3/5 Spider creature with reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)

editions.flavor: It wants only to dress you in silk.

name: Hidden Stag
text:
Whenever an opponent plays a land, if Hidden Stag is an enchantment, Hidden Stag becomes a 3/2 Elk Beast creature.
Whenever you play a land, if Hidden Stag is a creature, Hidden Stag becomes an enchantment.

name: Hidden Stockpile
text:
Revolt — At the beginning of your end step, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.
{1}, Sacrifice a creature: Scry 1.

name: Hidden Strings
text:
You may tap or untap target permanent, then you may tap or untap another target permanent.
Cipher (Then you may exile this spell card encoded on a creature you control. Whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player, its controller may cast a copy of the encoded card without paying its mana cost.)

name: Hide
text: Put target artifact or enchantment on the bottom of its owner's library.

name: Hideous End
text: Destroy target nonblack creature. Its controller loses 2 life.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Garruk vs. Liliana
editions.flavor:
"A little dark magic won't stop me. The worse the curse, the better the prize."
—Radavi, Joraga relic hunter, last words

"A little dark magic won't stop me. The worse the curse, the better the prize."
—Radavi, Joraga relic hunter, last words

"A little dark magic won't stop me. The worse the curse, the better the prize."
—Radavi, Joraga relic hunter, last words

editions.set: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
editions.flavor: Death is a generous author, always willing to grant a stirring final chapter.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
editions.flavor:
"A little dark magic won't stop me. The worse the curse, the better the prize."
—Radavi, Joraga relic hunter, last words

"A little dark magic won't stop me. The worse the curse, the better the prize."
—Radavi, Joraga relic hunter, last words

name: Hideous Laughter
text:
All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.
Splice onto Arcane {3}{B}{B} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

name: Hideous Visage
text: Creatures you control gain intimidate until end of turn. (Each of those creatures can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)

editions.flavor: "Seeing you cower before me is its own reward."

name: Hidetsugu's Second Rite
text: If target player has exactly 10 life, Hidetsugu's Second Rite deals 10 damage to that player.

editions.flavor: Hidetsugu never relinquished a grudge. He let it burn within him, gathering ever greater intensity until the final moment of vengeance.

name: Hieroglyphic Illumination
text:
Draw two cards.
Cycling {U} ({U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

editions.flavor: "The answers are here. This is the way through the trial."

name: Highborn Ghoul
text: Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)

editions.flavor:
"All the dead sleep lightly here, no matter how refined their beds may be."
—Grafdigger Wulmer

name: High Ground
text: Each creature you control can block an additional creature each combat.

editions.flavor: In war, as in society, position is everything.
In war, as in society, position is everything.

name: Highland Berserker
text: Whenever Highland Berserker or another Ally enters the battlefield under your control, you may have Ally creatures you control gain first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: He gets paid by the axe.

name: Highland Game
text: When Highland Game dies, you gain 2 life.

editions.flavor:
"Bring down a stag and fix its horns upon her head. This one hears the whispers."
—Chianul, at the weaving of Arel
Though slow-witted and slow-moving, they are quick to anger.

name: Highland Lake
text:
Highland Lake enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} or {R} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: With the fate of Innistrad uncertain, some seek solace in remote areas.
With the fate of Innistrad uncertain, some seek solace in remote areas.

name: Highland Weald
text:
Highland Weald enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"Our noble land, enslaved by Rime,
Is it our fate to freeze through time?
If this be true, oh wicked crime."
—The Dynasty of Winter Kings

name: High Market
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: If it can't be had here, it can't be had on any world.
If it can't be had here, it can't be had on any world.
If it can't be had here, it can't be had on any world.

name: High Priest of Penance
text: Whenever High Priest of Penance is dealt damage, you may destroy target nonland permanent.

editions.flavor: "All I require is faith, loyalty, obedience, trust, and complete and utter devotion."

name: High Seas
text: Red creature spells and green creature spells cost {1} more to cast.

editions.flavor:
Bend as the wave breaks or it will break you as well.
—Saprazzan saying

name: High Sentinels of Arashin
text:
Flying
High Sentinels of Arashin gets +1/+1 for each other creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it.
{3}{W}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

name: Highspire Artisan
text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Fabricate 1 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it or create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.)

name: Highspire Infusion
text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn. You get {E}{E} (two energy counters).

editions.flavor:
"If nothing else, the Inventors' Fair taught us that we're only beginning to discover aether's true potential."
—Kershan Danil, Highspire artisan

name: Highspire Mantis
text: Flying, trample

editions.flavor: Its wings produce a high-pitched, barely audible whirring sound in flight. Only Jeskai masters are quiet enough to hear one coming.

name: High Tide
text: Until end of turn, whenever a player taps an Island for mana, that player adds {U} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

editions.flavor:
"May Svyelun and her tides favor you."
—Traditional merfolk blessing

"May Svyelun and her tides favor you."
—Traditional Merfolk blessing

"When the very tides turn against you, it's time to consider retirement."
—General Khurzog

"By the time their enemies noticed the sea's changing mood, the Vodalians had often shifted formation and were ready to attack."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. V
"There's nothing like the high seas to clear your head or escape pursuers."
"There's nothing like the high seas to clear your head or escape pursuers."

name: Hightide Hermit
text:
Defender
When Hightide Hermit enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E}{E}{E} (four energy counters).
Pay {E}{E}: Hightide Hermit can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender.

name: Highway Robber
text: When Highway Robber enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: "Tonight, madam, it's your money and your life."
"Tonight, madam, it's your money and your life."
"Tonight, madam, it's your money and your life."

name: Higure, the Still Wind
text:
Ninjutsu {2}{U}{U} ({2}{U}{U}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)
Whenever Higure, the Still Wind deals combat damage to a player, you may search your library for a Ninja card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
{2}: Target Ninja creature can't be blocked this turn.

name: Higure, the Still Wind Avatar
text: Whenever a nontoken creature you control deals combat damage to an opponent, choose a creature card at random from your library, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: BOK Participation Avatar

name: Hijack
text: Gain control of target artifact or creature until end of turn. Untap it. It gains haste until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Whoa there. Easy. We're just going to take a little detour."

name: Hikari, Twilight Guardian
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may exile Hikari, Twilight Guardian. If you do, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

name: Hinder
text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put that card on the top or bottom of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"Do not react to force in kind. Turn it aside. Direct it to where it can do no harm."
—Meloku the Clouded Mirror

name: Hindering Light
text:
Counter target spell that targets you or a permanent you control.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Centuries of careful practice have elevated the casting of protective spells to an art form. What little offensive magic remains on Bant stands little chance of breaching them.

name: Hindering Touch
text:
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {2}.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

name: Hindervines
text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn by creatures with no +1/+1 counters on them.

editions.flavor:
"Woodlands and laws. Both grow faster than the Azorius's ability to manage them."
—Suniel the Woodwise

name: Hinterland Drake
text:
Flying
Hinterland Drake can't block artifact creatures.

editions.flavor:
"As a kid, I dreamed of flying on those wild drakes. They inspired me to build wings of my own."
—Nadja Cloudtoucher, aerowright

name: Hinterland Harbor
text:
Hinterland Harbor enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Forest or an Island.
{T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: In places where the sea meets the trees, it's easy to forget the darkness that rules most of Innistrad.

name: Hinterland Hermit
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Hinterland Hermit.

editions.flavor: He tried to live far from those he could hurt . . .

name: Hinterland Logger
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Hinterland Logger.

editions.flavor:
"There's a forester lives up in the highlands. Tried to sell her one of my finest axes at a bargain, but she wasn't interested."
—Old Rutstein

name: Hinterland Scourge
text:
Hinterland Scourge must be blocked if able.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Hinterland Scourge.

editions.flavor: . . . but the monster within was a tireless hunter.

name: Hint of Insanity
text: Target player reveals his or her hand. That player discards all nonland cards with the same name as another card in his or her hand.

editions.flavor: "Practice makes perfect, but obsession makes better."

name: Hipparion
text: Hipparion can't block creatures with power 3 or greater unless you pay {1}.

editions.flavor:
"Someone once said that Hipparions are to Warriors what Aesthir are to Skyknights. Don't believe it."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

"Someone once said that hipparions are to warriors what aesthir are to skyknights. Don't believe it."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Hired Giant
text: When Hired Giant enters the battlefield, each other player may search his or her library for a land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then each player who searched his or her library this way shuffles it.

name: Hired Heist
text:
Hidden agenda (Start the game with this conspiracy face down in the command zone and secretly name a card. You may turn this conspiracy face up any time and reveal the chosen name.)
Whenever a creature you control with the chosen name deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {U}. If you do, draw a card.

name: Hired Muscle
text:
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Hired Muscle.
At the beginning of the end step, if there are two or more ki counters on Hired Muscle, you may flip it.

name: Hired Torturer
text:
Defender
{3}{B}, {T}: Target opponent loses 2 life, then reveals a card at random from his or her hand.

editions.flavor: "Follow your passion, I always say. Might as well get paid to do what you love."

name: Hisoka, Minamo Sensei
text: {2}{U}, Discard a card: Counter target spell if it has the same converted mana cost as the discarded card.

editions.flavor: "By all rights we should have perished in the Kami War. Our perseverence is a tribute to mortal ingenuity. And perhaps a few forgotten secrets found in the nick of time."

name: Hisoka's Defiance
text: Counter target Spirit or Arcane spell.

editions.flavor: "With every passing day, the kami shape our world to suit their will. I, for one, would not see them succeed."

name: Hisoka's Guard
text:
You may choose not to untap Hisoka's Guard during your untap step.
{1}{U}, {T}: Target creature you control other than Hisoka's Guard has shroud for as long as Hisoka's Guard remains tapped. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

name: Hissing Iguanar
text: Whenever another creature dies, you may have Hissing Iguanar deal 1 damage to target player.

editions.flavor: Viashino thrashes keep iguanars as hunting companions, giving them wounded captives as playthings.
Viashino thrashes keep iguanars as hunting companions, giving them wounded captives as playthings.
Viashino thrashes keep iguanars as hunting companions, giving them wounded captives as playthings.

name: Hissing Miasma
text: Whenever a creature attacks you, its controller loses 1 life.

editions.flavor: All that remains when the fog finishes are neat piles of polished bones, like acid-etched glass. Orzhov servants collect them to make altar chimes.

name: Hissing Quagmire
text:
Hissing Quagmire enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool.
{1}{B}{G}: Hissing Quagmire becomes a 2/2 black and green Elemental creature with deathtouch until end of turn. It's still a land.

name: Hit
text: Target player sacrifices an artifact or creature. Hit deals damage to that player equal to that permanent's converted mana cost.

name: Hitchclaw Recluse
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

editions.flavor: Not all spiders need webs to catch their prey.

name: Hive Mind
text: Whenever a player casts an instant or sorcery spell, each other player copies that spell. Each of those players may choose new targets for his or her copy.

editions.flavor:
"All consciousness is one, separated only by a thin veil of the physical."
—Jace Beleren

name: Hive Stirrings
text: Create two 1/1 colorless Sliver creature tokens.

editions.flavor: Sliver young are sorted into clutches according to their potential and their future role. Human scholars can only guess how those are determined.

name: Hivestone
text: Creatures you control are Slivers in addition to their other creature types.

editions.flavor: Rath's evincars used hivestones to control the slivers, but the overlay put their power into unwitting hands. Now the stones make not masters, but slaves.

name: Hivis of the Scale
text:
You may choose not to untap Hivis of the Scale during your untap step.
{T}: Gain control of target Dragon for as long as you control Hivis and Hivis remains tapped.

name: Hixus, Prison Warden
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Whenever a creature deals combat damage to you, if Hixus, Prison Warden entered the battlefield this turn, exile that creature until Hixus leaves the battlefield. (That creature returns under its owner's control.)

name: Hoarder's Greed
text: You lose 2 life and draw two cards, then clash with an opponent. If you win, repeat this process. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

name: Hoarding Dragon
text:
Flying
When Hoarding Dragon enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an artifact card, exile it, then shuffle your library.
When Hoarding Dragon dies, you may put the exiled card into its owner's hand.

name: Hoard-Smelter Dragon
text:
